name: Gold Strike Hotel and Gambling Hall

reviews.text: I have to be honest...we were on a tight budget on our way to a trade show in Las Vegas so we figured Saturday night we could save some money so we stayed at the Gold Strike. The deluxe room was huge and clean, no problem there. The slots were tight, there was a bar with no bartender and not even set up. We had to bail at this point for more entertainment. We split down the road to Whiskey Petes, the Primm, and Buffalo Bills where we heard music, had lots of drinks and road the Monarail to each of those locations. In the morning we woke up to the elephants above us, the floor was booming away and squeaky. So much for sleeping in. Next time we'll stay at Stateline in one of the above hotels mentioned.
reviews.title: Great Value for Room Only!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dated, dirty and a bad smell coming from the sink. Noisy, gum wrappers on the floor and someone elses hair in the shower. That being said....it is a $30 room. Can't figure out what some of the other reviewers were smoking. Come here for a honymoon and go directly to Las vegas for a quicike divorce :-)
reviews.title: A room for $30. You get what you pay for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best kept secrets in the area, good food, great price, great fun. Nobody comes to vegas to sleep in your bed, and stay in your rooms anyway. Its just a short drive into town, and when its time to leave, your already in front of the traffic depending on which way you are going. You can also upgrade to a jacuzzi room. Your Comps are your Comps, which can be used for food,gas, or lodging. I will always stay in Jean,NV. Its also close to Primm,Nv, where some of the best shows and concerts are given. Save your money on lodging, and stay in Jean.
reviews.title: Best Kept Secret

reviews.text: This is a stand alone hotel/ casino is on the interstate about 30 miles west of Las Vegas. An easy stop if travelling thru and not wanting to stay on the strip, but still have a gamble.
reviews.title: A gamble on the highway

likes.liked: — convenient, good pool, good restaurant, gambling on site
likes.disliked: — furninshings / decoration dated, rooms on10 floors

reviews.text: This is a cheap stay at $35 standard frequented by truck drivers. I had a suite for $90. The rooms are somewhat dated and a the hotel is a little lived in but quite acceptable
reviews.title: I LOVE the Gold Strike!!!!!

likes.liked: — Cheapest hotel ever! Great Value! Seats in shower!
likes.disliked: — It's in the middle of nowhere, but 30 minutes from everything.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were going to Primm and on the way we decided to stop for the night at the Gold Strike Casino. We had been there before and had a room comp coming to us, which we took advantage of this time out. This was the first time we had ever stayed overnight. After checking in we went to the room. It was passable. Clean but run down. The floor had waves in it and creaked. We then went into the casino. Since the last time we were there, many machines had been replaced. First problem. No tickets. When you want to take your money out of a slot machine you have to wait, sometimes 30 minutes or more for and "attendant" to hand pay you. Whether it is $1.00 or $100 you have to wait to get your money. In this day and age that is unacceptable. The machines have to be the tightest in all of Nevada. I played a minimum of 15 machines and my husband almost as many. You can not hit there. Ridiculous! Then we were hungry, so we went to the buffet. What an abomination. The food was horrible. Everything had a funny taste. Needless to say we left most of the meal on the plate. That evening back in our room when we were trying to sleep, there seemed to be furniture movers directly above us. All night long banging and footsteps could be heard in our room. We felt like we were the stars of some horrible Twilight Zone episode. Whatever you do, avoid the Gold Strike. They will suck the money out of your pockets, serve you lousy food and make sure you get very little if any rest while you are there.
reviews.title: Beware of the GoldStrike Casino Hotel.

reviews.text: When travelling between Utah and California we alway stop at the Gold Strike for lunch and to get out of the car to take a break for a minute. I have not stayed in the hotel, only eaten there with family and friends. The coffee shop is very reasonably priced. We were surprised how cheap the bill was for 7 of us to eat. I had a great sandwich, all of the food was pretty standard casino fare. If you are looking for a break from I-15, this is it.
reviews.title: Quick place to stop and refresh

reviews.text: I stay at the Gold Strike a couple of times a year. The hotel is a bit rundown but clean and my room is always complimentary. I get lots of free room offers at hotel casinos but the reason why we go to Gold Strike is the casino is fun and a buck goes a long way. They have easily obtained comps when you use your players card. The Gold Strike Steakhouse is very good and worth the price. They are very prompt with the complimentary adult beverages and you can still get a great prime rib deal at the coffee shop. I always have a really relaxed good time playing at the casino there. I recommend of someone who likes to play old school slots that still take coins.
reviews.title: It's not the Bellagio but it is a LOT of fun

reviews.text: I do not recommend for somone who hates the smell of cigarette smoke as the casino is VERY smokey. I do not recommend the Chinese restaurant to anyone with taste buds.
reviews.title: Great prime rib buffett

reviews.text: I very much enjoy The Gold Strike but could see where it is not for everyone. If you like some of the older casinos in downtown Las Vegas this might be the place for you. If The Palms is more your thing then maybe not so much for you.
reviews.title: Great value for your money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I were to say that this hotel is a piece of crap that would be a great review for them. I am in the market to stay for the least amount of money as possible and don't care about luxury (so not expecting much). The good thing about this hotel is that you'll only get and be offended for a short time cause then you'll just have to laugh at how bad this hotel is. The restaurants are very expensive for this hotel. We were in the cafe and were ignored for 20mins after we were seated. It was no excuse cause there were only about 4 tables that had customers seated. There were 3 employees talking to each other and ignoring the customers. Then to my surprise the chef and kitchen help comes out and joins them for like 10mins. We finally get our order and ask for hot sauce and the waitress said "well, I have to go all the way to the kitchen for that so is there anything else why I'm in there". This was were I started laughing and started looking for the hidden camera cause the damn kitchen was less than 15-20 feet from where we were sitting. The food quality is very bad and felt it was better to drive back 11 miles to Primm Nevada to eat. Where the food was great and affordable. Anyways, lets talk more about the Gold Strike. We nicknamed this place " ----- " and we laugh when we talk about it. The machines are very tight and the employees outside of the cafe are just as if not more rude than the ones inside. Oh yeah and the buffet they have set up not only has cream of the crap for food like chili spaghetti " ill let you be the judge on that one" but all the booths have "employees only" signs on them and will not wait on you if you sit there anyway. I would give this hotel an award for being the worst place I've ever stayed and will probably sleep in my car before staying here again. If you read this and stay there knowing this you deserve the royal treatment that you'll receive at Gold Strike. ha ha I hope this helps if your looking for a place to stay. Primm has 3 hotels that are nice, friendly staff, cheap, and very clean with great food so if you don't want to drive or stay in Vegas that should be your choice. -Kurt 28 San Diego
reviews.title: Severe Problems!!!

reviews.text: Stayed there on a Thursday night, paid $35, so can't complain. It's not the Ritz or Four Seasons, the rooms were clean but handles are broken off the furniture, the old wall-mounted AC/heat creaks and groans, the carpet is frayed with fiber showing in numerous place, the 80's era TV has seven channels, the $5 alarm clock sort of works. But what the heck, it is certainly not without its charms. Employees are cordial, slots were a bit stingy, but I could have hit it on a bad day for me, so that's very subjective. Coffee shop was good, no complaints about my ham 'n eggs.
reviews.title: Old, beat up, but old school Nevada casino! Don't keep driving, stop in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are trying to impress someone, or have a memorable and special evening, this is not the place. But don't keep driving! Not if you're looking for an economical place to set down for a night! The desert is beautiful, this is in the middle of an expanse of the I-15, and is more than suitable for a low-priced room.
reviews.title: Keep driving!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was probably the worst I have ever stayed in when visiting Las Vegas. There used to be another hotel/casino across the highway called Nevada Landing which was the one we usually stayed at, but they apparently went under. Now the Gold Strike is the only one left. What a shame.
reviews.title: Surprisingly nice

reviews.text: There were actual footprints dirtying the bedsheets! The television was situated in a chifferobe with doors that did not open wide enough to allow the TV to be seen by anyone who was not sitting on the left-hand bed. There is no internet access at this hotel. The bathroom was reasonably clean but the shower was an enigma which I never managed to decode. The handle to start the water was a knob placed in the middle of another handle that was supposed to turn in one direction to regulate the water temperature - but instead, turning the knob for water temp would turn off the water flow. I never did find any cold water, only scalding hot. That was the most uncomfortable shower I have ever taken.
reviews.title: Great for business travelers that don't need plush.

likes.liked: — PRICE, and only 15 minute drive to the LV strip! The rooms were huge too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place isn't very nice, but you get what you pay for. The room was only $30, and a prime rib dinner was $10. The room was ok, and it is so much nicer than having to deal with all the crowds and insanity of Las Vegas. I make several trips a year between Utah and Los Angeles, and this make for an easy in, easy out stop, that allows me not to drive so much per day. But I would not recommend it to anyone who wants to be entertained. If you need more than a bed and food, then go to Vegas or even Primm where there are more things to do.
reviews.title: Cheap room and food, make up for being a little seedy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This used to be our favorite stop near Vegas. It had clean rooms, dirt cheap rates, good food, and a decent casino. For our latest (and last) stay the room was filthy, the rates were jacked up, and the food was medicore. How filthy? Well, we spread out the towels and shower mat on the floor to avoid walking on the carpet. I only removed my shoes when climbing into bed. The little plastic ads and menues in the room were all sticky. There were crumbs on the table and hair in the sink. The furniture is all beat up and ready for the junk pile. The elevator closest to our room was out of order throughout our stay. The seals around the wall HVAC unit were shot, so we listened to the wind whistling all night long.
reviews.title: Filty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just one upside: the staff at the front desk, in the casino, and restaurants were all helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: rough around the edges, but welcome hotel on the edge of vegas

reviews.text: There used to be a hotel-casino called Nevada Landing under the same ownership located on the other side of I-15. It was demolished a few years ago. This is like saying a final good-bye to an old friend, but it's time to demolish the Gold Strike as well.
reviews.title: Just passing through & found tired but very good value hotel

reviews.text: second time staying here. $29 price is the lure. but you get a good deal for what you pay compared to other low priced hotels i've stayed. hotel is getting old and it shows in the lobbies and carpets. but rooms are large and fairly comfortable. would stay here again, for sure.
reviews.title: clean
